div.p: All LMSV schools are currently closed. For information about school closures, distance learning, community supports and meals, please click on a link below.

article.class: card mt-3r post-2 page type-page status-publish hentry

div.p: Welcome to La Mesa-Spring Valley Schools, where we have unique and dynamic programs and instructional pathways to engage and inspire all children! La Mesa-Spring Valley Schools is proud to serve our students and families with caring teachers and staff members and innovative instruction. Please look around, learn more about us, and enroll today!
div.h3: Visit our social media channels to learn more about who we are:

div.p: Since the inter and intra district transfer windows closed during the time of emergency school closures, we will be extending the transfer window through April 30 2020 for this year only.
Families will be able to submit transfers in one of three ways:

ol.li: In person at the Education Center on Thursdays, beginning April 23, from 9:00 AM to 2:00 PM *

div.p: *We will have staff on hand in the boardroom to answer questions regarding transfers and there will be a dropbox available outside for those who just want to drop off transfer forms. All required health policies will be followed.
Blank transfer forms are available online, or can be picked up at the district on Thursdays, as indicated above.

Once the transfer window closes on 4/30, all remaining requests will be processed and applicable lotteries will be held. Families will be notified as soon as possible. It is our intent to still try to meet our beginning of June notification timeline.

p.em: If you are requesting an interdistrict transfer (i.e. a transfer into LMSV from another district), and you are unable to obtain the signed release from the other district due to their closure requirements, you may submit a copy of your request to LMSV pending approval by the other district (they will still need to sign the release before any transfer will be officially approved). This will inform us of your intention/request during our available transfer window. We will make every attempt to work with you to process these as districts make themselves available to sign release forms.

div.p: Beginning this Wednesday, April 1, we will transition to multi-meal packs twice per week.
On Mondays, we will provide multi-meal packs to include breakfast and lunch for two days.

On Wednesdays we will provide multi-meal packs of breakfast and lunch for three days. Next week only: We will provide single-meal packs through Tuesday, March 31, with multi-meal packs starting on Wednesday, April 1.
Meals can be picked up 11 a.m.-1 p.m. at the following locations:

ul.li: Bancroft Elementary School, 8805 Tyler Street, Spring Valley, CA 91977
La Mesa Arts Academy, 4200 Parks Avenue, La Mesa, CA 91941
Parkway Middle School, 9009 Park Plaza Drive, La Mesa, CA 91942
Spring Valley Academy, 3900 Conrad Drive, Spring Valley, CA 91977
STEAM Academy, 1001 Leland Street, Spring Valley, CA 91978

p.a: Please take this survey to share how we can best support you with distance learning.

div.p: During this time of uncertainty and required in-home learning, Cox is helping get families in need connected to the internet through our Connect2Compete program.

p.br: We have updated our website to include a page with links to online courses, login information to access our online curriculum resources, and links to printable activities, games and lessons. This can be found at https://www.lmsvschools.org/learning-resources/. Included on this webpage will be packets of independent study work that you can download by grade level if you are interested in using them at home with your child. If you would like to pick up a pre-printed packet, they will be available at each of our middle school campuses during the meal serving windows (11:00 AM to 1:00 PM weekdays), except on rainy days when packets will not be available due to inclement weather.

One of our ongoing commitments is to help connect our families with resources and supports during this time. We have created a page on our website to house lists of resources that families might need, including social and emotional supports for children and families. Those resources can be found at https://www.lmsvschools.org/community-resources.

div.p: Because district operations have been limited to only the most essential services, we have created a resource line to help direct those in need to community supports and charitable organizations.

This line will go straight to voicemail, but will be regularly monitored and responded to. The intent of the resource line is to try and address questions that may not have been answered on the community resources page linked above. The resource line is 619-771-6085.

img.alt: Portrait of happy children holding books and wearing backpack at elementary school.

ul.li: All-day kindergarten offered at all schools
Engaging before and after school care offered at all schools
Exemplary staff dedicated to educating, supporting, and nurturing ALL children

Innovative educational programs and academies including:
Arts and Music
Dual Language Immersion and Acquisition
International Baccalaureate (candidate school)
No Excuses University
Science, Technology, Engineering, Arts, Mathematics (STEAM)

div.p: Enroll Today!
ESS + District +

Transitional Kindergarten (TK) is the first year of a two-year kindergarten experience offering children a developmentally appropriate curriculum taught by credentialed teachers to ensure students enter kindergarten with the academic, social and emotional skills needed for success.
Homelessness should not affect your child's education.
Spread the word about kindness at STEAM Academy! STEAM Academy is a grades 4-8 school specializing in science, technology, engineering, arts and math.
Kindergarten enrollment is now open in LMSV schools. Visit lmsvschools.org to learn about upcoming parent information meetings and options for kindergarten.
Students at Highlands Elementary School engage with teachers, staff and the school principal to feel connected and a sense of belonging.

div.span:
The La Mesa-Spring Valley School District is committed to equal opportunity for all individuals in education. The district prohibits discrimination, harassment, intimidation or bullying based on actual or perceived race, color, ancestry, national origin, nationality, ethnic group identification, ethnicity, age, religion, marital or parental status, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression or association with a person or group with one or more of these actual or perceived characteristics. Complaints alleging unlawful discrimination may be filed using the district’s Uniform Complaint Procedures. (BP 0410 BP 1312.3)
La Mesa-Spring Valley Schools is committed to providing access to all individuals, with or without disabilities, seeking information on our website. LMSV Schools will comply with the standards of the World Wide Web Consortium's Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.0 Level AA. If, because of a disability, you are having difficulty accessing any information on this website, please contact us at (619) 668-5700.
© 2020 La Mesa Spring Valley Schools | Privacy Policy | Staff Login
